course_title: Concepts and Methods in ID Epidemiology
class_notes: EPI/GLEPI/EH-EPI students only. All others may enroll on May 31st. Pre-requisite: EPI 530 and some experience using R/Studio or instructor permission, Laptop required.
course_description: The course will provide an overview of the history, concepts and analytical methods that specifically apply to the study of infectious diseases. Topics covered include measures of frequency, burden and natural history; immune-epidemiology; vaccine epidemiology; methods for emerging infectious diseases; fundamentals of modeling and the application of `classicÂ¿ epi methods to infectious diseases.  Prerequisites: EPI 530 and EPI 540 with experience using R. This is a required course for the Infectious Disease Epidemiology certificate program.
schedule_location: T 9am-11:50am in Grace Crum Rollins RAR
sections: Class Nbr: 5188, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 9-11:50a, Instructor: Team, Status: Open
